abstract: The entire cable business, and Comcast, the country’s largest cable company, are sitting pretty.
snippet: The entire cable business, and Comcast, the country’s largest cable company, are sitting pretty.
lead_paragraph: THREE years ago, with the cable television industry in the doldrums, the Comcast Corporation’s chairman, Brian L. Roberts, approached Mel Karmazin, then the president of Viacom, with a modest proposal: give Comcast the right to show programming from such Viacom properties as CBS and MTV on the cable company’s channels so it could have a leg up on its rivals.

headline.main: Once Given Up for Dead, Comcast Defies Its Obits
headline.print_headline: Once Given Up for Dead, Comcast Defies Its Obits
